plot outline: Aditi Majumdar is an educated middle-aged housewife, bored with her humdrum existence. Her friend, Hemenmama, encourages her to start writing, and soon her first work is published. Unfortunately, her family shows no enthusiasm and even disparages her literary efforts. Her husband stops her from meeting her friend. The painful realization comes and she decides to give up writing and composes a letter to Hemenmama informing him of this. Next day, she tears the letter and lets the winter breeze whisk away the pieces of paper.
title: Hemanter Pakhi
plot: Aditi Majumdar is an educated middle-aged housewife, bored with her humdrum existence. Her friend, Hemenmama, encourages her to start writing, and soon her first work is published. Unfortunately, her family shows no enthusiasm and even disparages her literary efforts. Her husband stops her from meeting her friend. The painful realization comes and she decides to give up writing and composes a letter to Hemenmama informing him of this. Next day, she tears the letter and lets the winter breeze whisk away the pieces of paper.

This is a story of a Bengali housewife who takes up writing as a career after twenty three years of her marriage. She is introduced to a new world and new friends. Her work gets appreciated and this brings a new twist in her life. She starts discovering her husband and her beloved children in new light. This creates trouble in her family and she sacrifices her dream for the sake of her family.
